items.title: Rule breach in final stretch of Sydney to Hobart sees rival crowned winner
items.description: Double-handed Min River makes history by becoming the first double-handed yacht to take out the overall win in the Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race and the first to do so with a female skipper.

items.title: How a 'silly mistake' cost BNC Sydney to Hobart prize glory
items.description: They should be celebrating a historic win — instead, the crew of BNC is coming to terms with how a "silly mistake" cost them the "crown jewel" prize of Sydney to Hobart overall handicap.

items.title: Ex-Australian cricketer Damien Martyn seriously ill in induced coma
items.description: Former Australian Test and limited overs batsman Damien Martyn is in hospital in Queensland in an induced coma after falling ill this week.

items.title: Revellers gather at sites across Australia for NYE celebrations
items.description: Revellers are jostling to secure a prime spot to enjoy celebrations taking place across Australia to mark the start of 2026.

items.title: 'Disgraceful' acts of looting in bushfire-ravaged community
items.description: After 19 homes were destroyed by bushfire in a picturesque east coast Tasmanian community, residents are now reporting instances of looting — described by the state premier as "disgraceful".

items.title: Praise for 'brave' officer's rescue bid as flooding claims a life
items.description: Police have renewed warnings about driving in floodwaters after a tragedy in Queensland's Gulf Country as the region endures a fourth day of drenching rain.

items.title: Crown casino workers announce New Year's Eve strike amid wage row
items.description: About 500 workers at Melbourne's Crown casino will stop work tonight after rejecting a proposal they say will cut pay for new workers and imperil those currently employed.

items.title: Calls for critics to 'grow up' after outcry over period mention on BBC
items.description: Alex Hartley says she was stunned by the reaction to her talking about her period during the BBC's radio commentary of the third Ashes Test.

items.title: 'Retribution' concerns amid surge in Islamophobic attacks after Bondi shooting
items.description: A rise in Islamophobic incidents prompts warnings from Muslim organisations that their communities are at risk of "retribution" and "collective punishment" following the mass shooting.

items.title: 'White Australia' flyer letterbox drop in Newcastle sparks police investigation
items.description: NSW Premier Chris Minns said police would "throw the book" at anyone behind flyers distributed to inner-city Newcastle letterboxes.

items.title: How illegitimate regulators operate in the name of a tiny African island
items.description: An ABC investigation has identified several individuals involved in a network of illegitimate corporate regulators and service firms.

items.title: Australian-made content and cheaper medication among January 1 changes
items.description: New Year's Day brings a host of new laws, regulations and guidelines into effect. Here's a quick breakdown of some of the changes.

items.title: JFK's granddaughter Tatiana Schlossberg dies aged 35
items.description: Tatiana Schlossberg revealed in an essay published in November that she had a rare form of terminal leukaemia.

items.title: Pet owner's warning as dog left 'frothing' after SA beach visit
items.description: Within 20 minutes of leaving an Adelaide beach dogs Lucy and Ella began breathing rapidly and fell "terribly sick", prompting their owner to issue a warning.

items.title: Man dead and 14yo boy missing after boat capsizes at Sydney beach
items.description: Police confirmed one man has drowned and a 14-year-old boy is missing after their boat capsized at Palm Beach on Sydney's Northern Beaches, with a search and rescue helicopter continuing to search the area.

items.title: New site lets you search online for paedophiles in your area
items.description: Queenslanders can search their local area for reportable sex offenders by providing proof of identification.

items.title: Meet the young artists pushing the boundaries of glassmaking
items.description: The art of glassblowing was popularised in a recent reality TV series, but these Australian artists are forging their own paths in the creative process of sculpting this tricky medium.

items.title: Socceroos striker cut down by injury
items.description: Martin Boyle, no stranger to the heartache of missing major tournaments with the Socceroos, was taken off after injuring his hamstring for Hibernian in the Scottish Premiership.

items.title: Piastri misses F1 Driver of the Year top three as Verstappen scoops award
items.description: Max Verstappen may not have won the F1 world title, but his fast finish to the year wins him Driver of the Year for the fifth straight year, while Oscar Piastri's disappointing end to the season is mirrored in the voting.

items.title: Denmark becomes first country in world to end letter delivery
items.description: After 401 years, the Danish postal service has ended letter deliveries as the country fully embraces the digital age.

items.title: 'Teetering on the brink': Fears of Middle East conflict after Saudi strikes in Yemen
items.description: The UAE has denied shipping weapons to Yemeni separatists after Saudi-led forces said they had bombed arms at the port city of Mukalla.

items.title: Nuclear-capable missiles deployed in Belarus, Russia claims
items.description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko, a staunch ally of the Kremlin, announced the deployment of the Oreshnik intermediate-range ballistic missiles earlier this month.

items.title: One dead in train crash near Machu Picchu, tourists among injured
items.description: A head-on collision between two tourist trains near Peru's most famous landmark kills a train driver and injures dozens.

items.title: Robbers use drill to steal $52m of cash and jewellery from German bank
items.description: According to police, the robbers drilled their way into the underground vault room of the savings bank from a parking garage.

items.title: Would you invest in your favourite craft beer? Nearly 1,000 people have
items.description: Brewer Richard Jeffares's Victorian company raised about $2.5 million from 993 investors in a matter of days through a method called crowd-sourced funding, also known as equity crowdfunding.
